page.title: 13Kinwarton Dovecote
page.content: The 14th Century Dovecote at Kinwarton is circular with a conical roof and is about 25 feet high. Inside there are 580 nest holes and little perches all the way round for the pigeons to land on before going into their holes. When you go inside it is very dark. When your eyes get accustomed to it you can see that there are quite small holes all the way round for the pigeons to nest in. In the middle there is a long pole. Attached to it is a ladder which can swing round so that the person up it could reach every nest-hole to see if there were any eggs or chicks. The Dovecote is owned and maintained by the National Trust. An entrance key can be obtained from Glebe Farm, Kinwarton.
